column3: Percentage of people aged 15 - 24 years old who are unemployed and are looking for a paid job
Percentage of people aged 15 and above who are unemployed and are looking for a paid job
Percentage of the population that is either employed or unemployed (that is, either working or actively seeking work)

column1: Percentage of employment by major industry group
column3: Percentage of the labor force that is employed against major industry groups
Percentage of the labor force that is employed against occupations

column1: Proportion of employed people living below $1 (PPP) per day, percentage
column3: Proportion of employed persons living below $1 (PPP) per day, or working poor, is the share of individuals who are employed, but nonetheless live in a household whose members are estimated to be living below the international poverty line of $1.25 a day, measured at 2005 international prices, adjusted for purchasing power parity (PPP).

Change in ownership of goods between one economy and another. The indicator comprises sales of goods as well as barter transactions or goods exchanged as part of gifts or grants between residents and non-residents

column1: Flows of Inward Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) by Host Country and Source Country
column3: An inward investment is the opposite of outward investment, an inward investment involves an external or foreign entity either investing in or purchasing the goods of a local economy. A common type of inward investment is a foreign direct investment (FDI).
